actor_awards.notes: Stevens won the Golden Globe for Best TV Star - Female in 1964 for 'The Farmer's Daughter'. She received Emmy nominations for her roles in 'The Dick Powell Show' (1962) and 'The Farmer's Daughter' (1964).

filmography.title: The World, the Flesh and the Devil
filmography.role_description: One of the last three survivors on Earth after a nuclear apocalypse, she finds herself the object of conflict between a black miner and a white bigot.
filmography.plot: A black miner trapped underground during a nuclear war emerges to find he is the only survivor, until he meets a white woman and later a white man.

filmography.title: Hang 'Em High
filmography.role_description: A widow obsessed with finding the men who murdered her husband, who nurses Clint Eastwood's character back to health.
filmography.plot: An innocent man survives a lynching and returns as a marshal to bring his tormentors to justice.

filmography.title: A Guide for the Married Man
filmography.role_description: The unsuspecting, devoted wife of a man who is being tutored in the art of adultery by his best friend.
filmography.plot: A faithful husband is given lessons in infidelity by his experienced friend, illustrated by a series of celebrity cameo vignettes.

filmography.title: Madigan
filmography.role_description: The frustrated, neglected wife of a tough New York City detective who struggles with the dangers and demands of his job.
filmography.plot: Two detectives have 72 hours to track down a killer after he steals their guns, while the police commissioner deals with internal corruption.

filmography.title: 5 Card Stud
filmography.role_description: A proprietor of a barbershop/brothel who becomes involved with a gambler investigating a series of murders.
filmography.plot: A gambler tries to solve a series of murders targeting the members of a lynch mob that killed a cheat in a poker game.

filmography.title: Firecreek
filmography.role_description: A lonely widow who unwittingly falls for the leader of a gang of outlaws terrorizing her town.
filmography.plot: A peace-loving sheriff must take a stand when a gang of vicious outlaws takes over his small town.

filmography.title: The Twilight Zone: The Hitch-Hiker
filmography.role_description: A young woman driving cross-country who becomes increasingly terrified by a mysterious hitchhiker who appears wherever she goes.
filmography.plot: A woman driving across the country is stalked by a hitchhiker who seems to be everywhere she looks.
filmography.awards: None (Episode widely considered one of the series' best)

filmography.title: The Twilight Zone: The Lateness of the Hour
filmography.role_description: The sensitive daughter of an inventor who grows increasingly disturbed by her father's army of robot servants.
filmography.plot: A young woman resents her father's reliance on his robot servants and demands he dismantle them, leading to a shocking revelation.

filmography.title: Cry Terror!
filmography.role_description: The wife of an electronics expert who is held hostage along with her husband and daughter by a mad bomber.
filmography.plot: A family is held hostage by a terrorist who forces the father to design a bomb for an extortion plot.

filmography.title: A Dream of Kings
filmography.role_description: A lonely widow who falls in love with a charismatic but reckless Greek community leader.
filmography.plot: A Greek-American man in Chicago tries to raise enough money to take his dying son to Greece.

filmography.title: The Farmer's Daughter
filmography.role_description: A young Swedish woman who becomes the governess for a widowed Congressman, eventually winning his heart.
filmography.plot: A sitcom about a farm girl of Swedish descent who works for a Congressman in Washington, D.C.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best TV Star - Female; Emmy: Nominated – Outstanding Actress

filmography.title: Run, Simon, Run
filmography.role_description: A social worker who falls in love with a Papago Indian man seeking revenge for his brother's murder.
filmography.plot: A Papago Indian returns from prison to seek revenge on his brother's killer while a social worker tries to help him move on.
filmography.awards: None (One of the highest-rated TV movies of 1970)

filmography.title: Man on Fire
filmography.role_description: The assistant and love interest to a bitter divorcé (Bing Crosby) fighting for custody of his son.
filmography.plot: A wealthy businessman tries to keep his ex-wife from having any contact with their son.

filmography.title: The Borgia Stick
filmography.role_description: A woman posing as a suburban housewife who is actually a front for a major organized crime syndicate.
filmography.plot: A couple living a seemingly idyllic suburban life are actually operatives for a crime ring planning to take over the US economy.

filmography.title: House of Cards
filmography.role_description: The wealthy widow of a French general who hires an American tutor to protect her son from a fascist conspiracy.
filmography.plot: An American in Paris stumbles upon a plot by a right-wing organization to take over France.

filmography.title: The New Interns
filmography.role_description: A dedicated social worker at a busy hospital who suffers a traumatic assault by juvenile delinquents.
filmography.plot: A drama following the personal and professional lives of young interns and staff at a large metropolitan hospital.

filmography.title: A Time for Killing
filmography.role_description: A missionary traveling with the Union army who is kidnapped by Confederate escapees and used as leverage.
filmography.plot: Confederate prisoners escape a Union camp and head for Mexico, pursued by a Union major who is also the fiancé of their hostage.

filmography.title: The Buccaneer
filmography.role_description: The daughter of the Governor of Louisiana who falls in love with the pirate Jean Lafitte.
filmography.plot: During the War of 1812, pirate Jean Lafitte helps General Andrew Jackson defend New Orleans against the British.

filmography.title: The Dick Powell Show: The Price of Tomatoes
filmography.role_description: A pregnant Romanian refugee who hitches a ride with a truck driver in a race to deliver his cargo.
filmography.plot: A truck driver trying to get his tomatoes to market on time picks up a pregnant woman in desperate need of help.
filmography.awards: Emmy: Nominated – Outstanding Single Performance by an Actress

filmography.title: The Alfred Hitchcock Hour: Forecast: Low Clouds and Coastal Fog
filmography.role_description: A woman alone in an isolated beach house who becomes terrorized by her own fears and a potential intruder.
filmography.plot: A woman refuses to help a stranded motorist, leading to a night of terror when she believes he has returned for revenge.

filmography.title: The Alfred Hitchcock Hour: My Brother, Richard
filmography.role_description: The wife of a district attorney who faces a moral dilemma when her brother-in-law is suspected of murder.
filmography.plot: A district attorney running for governor discovers his brother has killed a man and must decide between family and justice.

filmography.title: Route 66: The Beryllium Eater
filmography.role_description: The neglected wife of a wealthy prospector who forms a connection with the show's protagonists.
filmography.plot: Todd and Buz encounter a fortune hunter and his unhappy wife while searching for beryllium in Arizona.

filmography.title: Route 66: Burning for Burning
filmography.role_description: A woman dealing with family conflict and a strained relationship with her mother in a rural town.
filmography.plot: The boys find work on a farm where a bitter mother rules her family with an iron fist, causing deep resentment.

filmography.title: Bonanza: The Newcomers
filmography.role_description: A dying woman traveling with a group of settlers who captures the heart of Hoss Cartwright.
filmography.plot: Hoss Cartwright falls in love with a beautiful but terminally ill woman who is passing through the Ponderosa.

filmography.title: The Mask of Sheba
filmography.role_description: A member of an anthropological team searching for a lost gold statue and missing explorers in Ethiopia.
filmography.plot: An expedition journeys into the African jungle to find a priceless gold statue and faces treachery from within.

filmography.title: The Most Deadly Game
filmography.role_description: One of three master criminologists who solve unusual murder cases; Stevens died shortly after filming the pilot.
filmography.plot: A trio of criminologists investigates only the most complex and high-profile murder cases.
